intro: Trachyrhachis trachypus, commonly known as the rough-stemmed germander, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from green to reddish. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. It has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rough texture. Trachyrhachis trachypus is often used in ornamental gardening due to its distinctive appearance and resilience.
